{"step_by_step_thinking": "Impression compound is a type of dental material used to take impressions of teeth and soft tissues. It is a thermoset material, meaning it hardens upon cooling and does not soften or melt upon reheating (B). It has a low coefficient of thermal conductivity, which means it does not conduct heat well (D). It does not warp at room temperature, but it can be softened by heating and then harden upon cooling (A). However, it does not show increased flow when kneaded with water (C).", "answer_choice": "C"}
